poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Where poets weigh their wordy husks And fletchers huss their witty barbs An occupying army huffs And humps its body armor.
From prison hulks that lie offshore A sergeant hunts and fishes. His little hunks of jailbait cry That hurts! Don't do that! In sordid huts he does it all the same. The same old song, the same rendition.
